greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Array read by antidiagonals: T(n,k) is the number of binary rooted trees with n leaves of k colors and all non-leaf nodes having out-degree 2.
comment: Not all k colors need to be used. The total number of nodes will be 2n-1.
See table 2.1 in the Johnson reference.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1275
V. P. Johnson, Enumeration Results on Leaf Labeled Trees, Ph. D. Dissertation, Univ. Southern Calif., 2012.
formula: G.f. of k-th column R(x) satisfies R(k) = k*x + (R(x)^2 + R(x^2))/2.
maple: A:= proc(n, k) option remember; `if`(n<2, k*n, `if`(n::odd, 0,
seq(seq(A(n, 1+d-n), n=1..d), d=1..12);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 23 2018
mathematica: Table[A[n, d-n+1], {d, 1, 12}, {n, 1, d}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Sep 02 2019, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
program: (PARI) \\ here R(n,k) gives k-th column as a vector.
R(n,k)={my(v=vector(n)); v[1]=k; for(n=2, n, v[n]=sum(j=1, (n-1)\2, v[j]*v[n-j]) + if(n%2, 0, binomial(v[n/2]+1, 2))); v}
results.author: _Andrew Howroyd_, Sep 22 2018
